title: The town of Baarn and surroundings in 1929 in color! [Silent].

sources.title: The town of Baarn and surroundings in 1929 in color! [Silent].
sources.description: An interesting (silent) film about the town of Baarn in The Netherlands in 1929. This film has been motion-stabilized, drastically speed-corrected, A.I. enhanced and colorized. We had to reduce the speed by nearly half because the original film was moving so fast! Baarn is a town in the province of Utrecht, more or less in the middle of The Netherlands situated on the river Eem. A famous landmark of Baarn is Paleis Soestdijk where the Grand mother (Queen Juliana) of our current King (Willem-Alexander), lived from 1948 until her death in 2004. The area was already inhabited from 8000 to 4500 BC. We would like to add more details about this film but can no longer find it in the archives of Beeld En Geluid who regrettably have changed their search engine a week ago. Please help us compose the timeline, thank you! Note: This film is without sound; we deliberately did not add any music, among other because it is becoming increasingly more difficult to find unique copyright-free music. Timeline (thanks to Anna Apple): 00:04 Train arriving at station Baarn from the direction of Hilversum. 00:56 Woods near Baarn 02:18 Badhotel Baarn 04:01 Swimming facilities in the river Eem 05:17 Probably the river Eem 05:57 Tol house at the Eemweg in Baarn 06:16 Brink (central market place of Baarn) and Pauluskerk 06:52 Kasteel de Hooge Vuursche 07:53 Kasteel Drakensteyn 08:16 Paleis Soestdijk 08:57 De Naald (Naald van Waterloo, opposite Paleis Soestdijk with a long lane in between) 09:20 Wilhelmina Pond in Baarn 09:48 Deer park Maarschalksbos in Baarn 11:11 Location? 11:28 Marisstraat 11:41 Mesdag Square in Baarn 12:18 All outside Baarn. Beginning at the Zuiderzee (now IJsselmeer) and most probably the villages of Bunschoten and/or Spakenburg. Source: Beels En Geluid
